intro: Galium setuliflorum var. koreanum, commonly known as the Korean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a ground cover in horticultural settings.
